newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH NET RESERVES UP TO $22.862 BLN IN JULY 1-20.
newsitem.headline: POLISH NET RESERVES UP TO $22.862 BLN IN JULY 1-20.

text.p: Poland's net foreign currency reserves grew by $209 million in July 1-20 to $22.862 billion and were $902 million higher than in July 1996, the National Bank of Poland said on Tuesday.
It said net reserves grew $1.196 billion in the January-July 20 period.
POLISH RESERVES (bln dollars) JULY 20 JUNE JULY 1996
NOTE - Figures in billions of dollars. Official reserves are those held by the state. Net reserves mean the total amount of hard currencies in the whole banking system.
